Name: Schaum's Outline of College Physics, 11th Edition (Schaum's Outline Series)

ReviewList.Text: I just finished taking AP Physics B (which will be split into AP Physics 1 and 2), and I used this book to supplement my school's textbook and a separate review book.  This book has a decent amount of practice problems which are mostly very easy, but the solved problems are very useful for understanding the physics concepts.  The explanation of certain topics in a few paragraphs really clarified explanations that were pages long in my textbook.  In the direct current electric circuits chapter of my textbook, there were very few practice problems and the whole concept was not explained very well, but the amount of problems and succinct explanations in this book really helped.  Overall, great book, especially for first or second-year physics students.

I used an earlier edition of this book that got destroyed in storage. I was happy to be able to repurchase it as the need arose. It is a useful book for both teachers and students. The development of topics is systematic and detailed with many diagrams and illustrations. Answers to questions are also conveniently located. I love the Schaum Series as a whole for its unique layout. The use of units of Physical quantities during the worked examples is instructive as well.

Definitely helps with basic concepts and ideas. Presents ideas in step by step form. With problems from a physics for physics majors class, the book does not start at the literal ground level for every problem. It starts with some given numbers in class you would have to find. But this is to be expected. It does allow for a clearer understanding of the underling material.

I would recommend this to any high school student taking physics or first year college student taking physics.  The worked out examples are extremely helpful.  This would not be a good "stand alone" book though as the concept explanations are not all that thorough but I don't think this was created to be used alone.

I wanted to love this book more then I do. In many cases the plethora of examples are very, very nice. However one big caveat for me is that if your in calculus based physics this book is VERY, VERY, LIGHT on calculus based physics. Much past Newton's laws this book has lost it's usefulness to me.

This is a fantastic resource for people who are studying physics. The overviews at the beginning of each section are quick and to the point. The reason that it loses a star is that there are some typos within the solutions for the problems. Otherwise this is a great find!

This book have been very helpful in the solved problems areas. There was many things I couldn't understand or know where to start when solving problems but they has helped me out so much! I would highly recommend this book. I used this for MCAT review.

I definitely think that this book had something to do with me getting an A in my college physics class.  I think it was really helpful, and the practice questions were a nice touch.  However, I personally wish that they had the answers for the problems they worked out during the chapter at the end, and just the problems in the chapter itself, but that's a minor complaint.  I just covered the answers with an index card.  There are questions at the end of the chapter whose answers you actually have to flip a few pages to find, but they don't work those ones out for you.  This may seem negative to people on the fence about buying this book, but even I, the type of person who loves to have all examples and problems worked out for them in review books, thought this was a great book.  I think the explanation for concepts, definitions, and problems were pretty good, and the explanations definitely helped me understand my class's topics better.  I'm sure there are better review books out there, but this one did the job for me so you probably don't have anything to lose if you just try it, and see if it works out for you.
This is a good resource containing plenty of solved physics problems.  It doesn't replace a textbook, but is much more readable and the solutions have decent explanations.
Aside from the occasional wrong answers, this book offers a brief rundown of all the concepts of college physics.  For its price, good enough.
Doesn't replace a textbook, but it's a very good outline for understanding those areas in which textbooks get too technical.
This book helped me a bit with my physics class.  It seemed kind of cheap, but written well enough.
helped me to understand physics concepts better! good exercises after each chapter as well!
Why does the book have quite a number of wrong answers after so much editions

Kinda weird to read it on Kindle.  They have to scramble to put in the equations, some of which are quite complicated.  I was a little taken aback that you couldn't jump to chapters.  You have  to put in bookmarks manually.  Tedious but feasible.

As a professional teacher I am Always on the lookout for new methods and ways to formulate problems. Schaum is the best book for this purpose and very competively priced when compared to books form the old world. Learning physics is like learning to play Chopin: you practice, practice and practice. With Schaums's outline of College Physics.
Great book to have as a study aid for such a complex course.

Love this book. I am a Physics tutor. I use this book to generate problems during sessions with students. Physics is a problem-solving course, and this book gives you plenty of chance to practice. Good for honors high school or college.
What can be said.  Its a Schaum's outline.  I gave me more practice problems...not something I enjoyed, but it help me improve my test grades.  The book arrived on-time.
very useful in teaching
Very useful book
Book, have fun
as described
It's a good book to review for when you are trying to be ahead of the game! ! ! !
Excellent
It was immediately available at a good price and was delivered promptly. This was time critical as I neede some additional problems for an exam I was setting.
good
Sincerely, this is the best for college physics. I have tried others but they are not as good as this one. It corrected all my misunderstanding!
